tasks.title: Create commands-quick.md
tasks.description: Create new quick-reference command documentation. Extract flag tables and terse descriptions from current docs/commands.md. Format for fast lookup by experienced users. Include link to deep version.
tasks.context:
## Task Context

Create a quick-reference version of command docs for experienced users.

## FR-4 Requirement
Create two versions: quick-lookup (flag tables, terse) and deep-dive (educational).

## Format
```markdown
# Quick Reference

Fast lookup for experienced users. For explanations, see [commands-deep.md](commands-deep.md).

## /mahabharatha:kurukshetra
Flags: `--workers=N`, `--mode container|task`, `--resume`
Start parallel workers. Requires approved design.
```

tasks.title: Create commands-deep.md
tasks.description: Create new deep-dive command documentation. Rewrite docs/commands.md following FR-1 educational pattern: each command gets CONCEPT → NARRATIVE → DIAGRAM → COMMAND treatment. Include real examples and expected output.

verification.command: test -f docs/commands-deep.md && grep -q 'What Is It' docs/commands-deep.md && grep -q 'Why' docs/commands-deep.md

tasks.context:
## Task Context

Create educational deep-dive version of command documentation.

## FR-1 Structure (REQUIRED)
Each command MUST follow this pattern:

### What Is It?
{1-2 paragraphs explaining concept in plain language}

### Why Use It?
{Narrative context - problem solved, real-world analogy}

### How It Works
{ASCII diagram with annotations}

### Using It
{Command examples with expected output}

## Target Audience (FR-2)
- New to AI coding assistants
- Knows basic programming, not distributed systems
- Needs concepts explained before implementation

tasks.title: Rewrite Tutorial.md

tasks.context:
## Task Context

Rewrite tutorial with simulated dialogues.

## FR-3 Dialogue Format
Planning phases MUST include dialogues:
```
ZERG: What problem does the minerals store solve for users?
YOU:  Users need to browse and purchase mineral products through a REST API.

ZERG: What are the core entities and their relationships?
YOU:  Products, Cart, Orders. A cart becomes an order at checkout.
```

## Phase Treatment
- Discovery phases (brainstorm, plan, design): Simulated dialogues
- Execution phases (kurukshetra, merge, status): Real command output

## FR-1 Structure
Each step: CONCEPT → NARRATIVE → DIAGRAM → COMMAND
